name: Spanish Garden Inn

reviews.text: My sisters and I here in October 07, when we parked outside our first thoughts were it was perhaps not as nice as the website had lead us to belive, HOW WRONG WE WERE. This hotel and the staff were totally and absolutly brilliant. Everyone was very firendly and helpful, in particular Aarron, who carried our very large and heavy cases to/from our car with a smile. The hotel provide a complimentary breakfast and newspaper, which is very rare in hotels in the USA and every day in reception there are fresh chocolate chip cookies for guests. In the reception they have a huge book for guests to peruse listing several local restaurants & giving details of the menus & prices, so it is easy to decide where to go before leaving the hotel. Excellant value for money and we cannot wait to visit again & stay longer next time. An absolute must to stay in when visiting Santa Barbara an oasis of tranquility.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are unanimously friendly. My only (minor) criticism was follow-up. We asked the front desk to make a dinner reservation at a new restaurant in Montecito we had read about. When we drove out there with our friends, we couldn't find the place, and it turned out that the restaurant (Sesto Senso) was so new it hadn't even opened. My mistake, perhaps, but it would have been helpful if the front desk had let me know that they weren't successful in making the booking.
reviews.title: Great Place, Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Inn in mid September and like the other recent reviewer were allocated room 13 but I'm delighted to say without any problems with plumbing noises!! I have to admit that we've stayed in Santa Barbara on 5 previous occassions and have always been completely seduced by the town,its setting, its climate,its facilities and its ambiance.
reviews.title: Room 13 not unlucky for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having admitted to a bias towards Santa Barbara, our previous positive feelings were even further enhanced by our stay at the Inn. This is a great place. The staff are excellent, the rooms are well equipped and maintained and the location is good (although some way from the beaches). Undoubtedly this is the best hotel of its type that we have ever stayed at and we offer everyone concerned many congratulations.
reviews.title: Quality Customer Service Maintains the Reputation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This could have been a disaster but the hotel really did pull out all the right stops to give us quality service.
reviews.title: Loved this place!

reviews.text: We arrived quite late after a really horrible Labour Day weekend drive from LAX and were immediately charmed by the hotel and staff. We were shown to out courtyard room and were again impressed by the quality of the room, the bathroom area and the general ambiance. We sank into out very comfortable bed to sleep off our jetlag from the UK and looked forward to a very pleasant night's sleep.
reviews.title: Fantastic Boutique Hotel

likes.liked: — Large rooms; clean; great beds and linens; large bathroms; plenty of storage
likes.disliked: — Breakfast was adaquate; could offer a few more items.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, at around 1.30am we were woken by incredibly loud and persistant plumbing noises of tanks filling and water running. Now, one expects occasional noise when another guest flushes the loo etc, but this was very loud and just didn't stop. So, off to reception where a very helpful night porter tried to ascertain what was wrong, called the hotel manager, offered us an alternative room for the night and handled two stressed out, jet lagged, tired people very well indeed. He told us that there would be another room available the next day and that they would move all our stuff etc. As the noise had finally stopped we decided to stay put for the night and move the next day. We never did get to the bottom of the reason for the noise - plumbing fault, odd & inconsiderate neighbours running baths repeatedly at 1am or a design fault in this part of the hotel (we were in room 13) but we did then get off to sleep.
reviews.title: Unbelievable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved our 4 day stay here. We got the romance package which included a local bottle of wine waiting for us in our room and an in-room massage for the both of us. The staff was extremely helpful about recommending restaurants and helping us plan our wine country tour. They also helped us ship our wine home. Very personal, even down to the always fresh batch of cookies sitting at the front desk. It was walking distance from great restaurants and shopping. It's a little pricey, but worth it for the personalized service you just can't get a the large resorts.
reviews.title: The place to stay in Santa Barbara

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in Room 22 (executive king) for 3 nights for a belated anniversary celebration. We were married in Santa Barbara, so we were really excited to return.

reviews.text: Overall, what we enjoyed most about our stay were all the little touches: DVD library at front desk, tea/coffee available at all hours in lobby, turn down service (with a printed weather report), and water bottles at our departure.

reviews.title: Loved this inn!
reviews.text: My family (2 teenagers and husband) stayed in 2 rooms at this wonderful inn. We traveled from LA up the coast to Napa, and this inn was our favorite. The staff was unbelievably accomodating. They knew us by name (thanks Frank!) and could not have been more accomdating. The rooms were spacious, very beautiful and clean. We had 2 suites on the main level right off the center court patio. The fire pit in the courtyard was very inviting at night, with candles lit on all the tables. The location was an easy 2 or so blocks from the heart of dowtown, so a great location. The breakfast buffet was very nice-fruit, quiche, granola, cereals, espresso if you want too! Would highly recommend this wonderful inn. We are very picky and we loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in many nicer places in California and this is one of the best. Sometimes when everything goes smoothly you don't appreciate it as much as you should.
reviews.title: Don't Take Perfect for Granted

reviews.text: The location was very convenient to a lot of walking distance locations. Parking was secure and covered in an underground garage with NO additional charge for parking. Check in was quick and polite. Super bell service. The room was lovely, very clean, great bedding, great toiletries, great view of clean pool with balcony and everything worked from every lamp to the fireplace and the heating and cooling.

aka: Inn Of The Spanish Garden Hotel Santa Barbara
description: Experience the jewel of luxury boutique Santa Barbara hotels. Spanish Garden Inn offers a sophisticated Spanish-Mediterranean inspired design, quality amenities and close attention to personal service. The hotel epitomizes the vitality of the City and honors its tradition by recreating the history, romance and intrigue of Spanish Colonial Santa Barbara.
